degrees.title: Bootcamp Full-Stack Developer
lessons: Learn technologies and tools used by active professionals.
Learn the flow of creating a web application and be able to implement it.
Know the work methodologies used in the companies where you will join.
Create a complete professional project portfolio to show all the knowledge acquired throughout the process.
Practice your soft skills to complete your professional profile and thus make easier your entry into the labor market.

degrees.title: Senior Technician in Cross-platform Application Development
lessons: Configure and operate computer systems, adapting the logical configuration of the system according to the needs of use and the criteria established.
Apply techniques and procedures related to safety in systems, services and applications, complying with the security plan.
Manage databases, interpreting their logical design and verifying data integrity, consistency, security and accessibility.
Manage development environments by adapting their configuration in each case to enable application development and deployment.
Develop cross-platform applications with access to databases using languages, libraries and tools suitable to specifications.
Integrate graphic content and multimedia components in cross-platform applications, using specific tools and meeting established requirements.
Develop applications for phones, PDAs and other mobile devices using specific development techniques and environments.
Develop multi process and multi-thread applications using specific programming techniques and libraries.
Participate in the implementation of ERP-CRM systems evaluating the usefulness of each of its modules.
Manage the information stored in ERP-CRM systems ensuring its integrity.

degrees.title: Technician in micro computer system and networks
lessons: Install and configure basic and application software, wired, wireless or mixed local networks and connected to public networks.
Install, configure, and maintain multi-user services, applications, and shared devices in a local network environment.
Assemble and configure computers and peripherals.
Determine the logistics associated with the installation, configuration and maintenance of micro informatics systems.
Diagnose dysfunctions in micro informatics systems and networks through functional tests.
Redesign the wiring and electronics of local networks in small environments and their connection to large area networks.
Execute established data recovery procedures and applications in case of data failure and loss in the system.
